Package org.reakteu.eewd.utils

Class GeoCalc

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.reakteu.eewd.utils.GeoCalc
  • public class GeoCalc
extends java.lang.Object
    Provides conversion and distance calculations on geodetic and Cartesian coordinates

        public static double[] Geo2Cart​(double latitude,
                                double longitude,
                                double altitude)
        Converts geodetic to Cartesian coordinates
        Parameters:
        latitude - geodetic latitude (degree)
        longitude - geodetic longitude (degree)
        altitude - height above WGS84 ellipsoid (meter)
        Returns:
        3-dimensional double array holding x, y, z Cartesian coordinates

      • SeismicWaveSurfaceDistance

        public static double SeismicWaveSurfaceDistance​(double depth,
                                                double waveRadius)
        Calculates the surface distance of a seismic wave to its epicenter. The earth is assumed to be a perfect sphere with a mean radius of SemiMeanAxis.
        Parameters:
        depth - hypocenter depth (meter)
        waveRadius - radius of the seismic wave (meter)
        Returns:
        epicenter distance (meter) or 0 if the wave did not reached the surface yet respectively traveled around the globe
        See Also:
        SeismicWaveSurfaceDistanceSphere(double, double, double)

      • SeismicWaveSurfaceDistance

        public static double SeismicWaveSurfaceDistance​(double depth,
                                                double waveRadius,
                                                double latitude)
        Calculates the surface distance of a seismic wave to its epicenter. The earth is assumed to be a perfect sphere with a radius derived from the WGS84 ellipsoid a the given latitude. SemiMeanAxis.
        Parameters:
        depth - hypocenter depth (meter)
        waveRadius - radius of the seismic wave (meter)
        latitude - hypocenter latitude (degree) used to calculate radius of the ellipsoid
        Returns:
        epicenter distance (meter) or 0 if the wave did not reached the surface yet respectively traveled around the globe
        See Also:
        SeismicWaveSurfaceDistanceSphere(double, double, double)

      • SeismicWaveSurfaceDistanceSphere

        public static double SeismicWaveSurfaceDistanceSphere​(double depth,
                                                      double waveRadius,
                                                      double sphereRadius)
        Calculates the surface distance of a seismic wave to its epicenter. The earth is assumed to be a perfect homogeneous sphere. Since this method returns only the 1-dimensional epicenter distance the calculation can be performed in 2D:

        1. Calculate one intercept point of the two circles representing the sphere (x²+y²=r_sphere²) and the wave (x²+(y- (r_sphere-depth))²=r_wave²)

        2. Calculate the angle and distance of the intercept point and the epicenter

        Parameters:
        depth - hypocenter depth (meter)
        waveRadius - radius of the seismic wave (meter)
        sphereRadius - radius of the earth
        Returns:
        epicenter distance (meter) or 0 if the wave did not reached the surface yet respectively traveled around the globe
